title: How to Change Who You Get Snapchat Notifications From

steps.title: Tap the chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the chat icon. This is at the bottom of the screen, to the left of the camera icon. If you want to stop receiving notifications from specific users or groups, you can choose to mute them . If you want to stop a user from interacting with you at all, you can block them .

steps.title: Tap and hold the user you want to mute.
steps.content: Tap and hold the user you want to mute. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Chat and Notification Settings.
steps.content: Tap Chat and Notification Settings . This is underneath Manage Friendship .

steps.title: Tap Notification Settings.
steps.content: Tap Notification Settings . This is the bottom option.

steps.title: Toggle on "Mute Chats".
steps.content: Toggle on "Mute Chats". The switch will turn green. All message notifications will be muted for this user.

steps.title: Toggle on "Mute Calls".
steps.content: Toggle on "Mute Calls". The switch will turn green. All call notifications will be muted for this user.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . Your changes will be saved. If you want to unmute the user, open the Notification Settings menu again and toggle the switches off.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. This is in the top-left corner. Use this method if you want to stop receiving general notifications for Mentions, Birthdays, Story Posts, and more. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner of your profile page.

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . You can find this underneath the My Account header.

steps.title: Toggle off the notification type.
steps.content: Toggle off the notification type. You'll see a long list of notifications. Turn off any you don't want. The switch will turn grey. If you want to turn off notifications for Stories you follow, scroll to the bottom, and tap Manage Story Notifications . Tap the user to remove them.

steps.title: If you have alerts on for a user, you'll be notified when they post Stories.
steps.content: If you have alerts on for a user, you'll be notified when they post Stories. Even if you have every other Snapchat notification turned off, if you are still receiving notifications that someone has posted on their Story, notifications for that user are still enabled. This setting is separate from the other notifications, so you may have missed it. To turn off notifications for a specific user, do the following: Tap your profile icon and select Settings (the cog icon). Tap Notifications . Scroll all the way down and tap Manage Story Notifications . Select the user to stop their Story notifications. If you continue to receive Story notifications in Snapchat, you can choose to silence all Snapchat notifications instead. On iPhone: Open the Settings app and tap Apps . Go to Snapchat > Notifications and toggle off Allow Notifications . On Android: Open the Settings app and tap Notifications . Go to App Notifications > Snapchat and then toggle off notifications.
